metadata.Title: CVE-2021-23239 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - low.
metadata.Description:
The sudoedit personality of Sudo before 1.9.5 may allow a local unprivileged user to perform arbitrary directory-existence tests by winning a sudo_edit.c race condition in replacing a user-controlled directory by a symlink to an arbitrary path.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-23239` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

sudo - 1.8.21p2-3ubuntu1.4
sudo-ldap - 1.8.21p2-3ubuntu1.4
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: sudo package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.8.21p2-3ubuntu1.4').
